title: Playboi Carti and Mitchell & Ness Team Up for Throwback NBA JerseyÂ Collection
summary: Shop exclusive jersey designs for the Los Angeles Lakers, Chicago Bulls, Atlanta Hawks and Philadelphia 76ers.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. As the beginning of the 2025-26 NBA season continues to deliver nonstop action, Playboi Carti and Mitchell & Ness have teamed up for a throwback NBA League collection. The limited-edition collaboration celebrates Cartiâ€™s love for basketball while reimagining classic NBA jerseys through his lens. Known for wearing basketball jerseys backwards, similar to hip hop group Kris Kross back in the ’90s, the collection offers a fresh take on basketball culture with a design sensibility rooted in authenticity, originality and individuality. The collection showcases exclusive designs from the Los Angeles Lakers, Chicago Bulls, Atlanta Hawks, New Jersey Nets, Orlando Magic, Philadelphia 76ers and two Toronto Raptors styles. Mitchell & Ness Marked with â€œYVLâ€, each piece pays homage to Cartiâ€™s Young Vamp Lifeâ€”a record label, collective, and clothing company built on his pure unfiltered individuality. Through his avant-garde, punk-inspired approach tâ€¦

title: L.A. Dodgers Troll Drake With Kendrick Lamar Lyrics After Toronto Blue Jays Lose WorldÂ Series
summary: The Canadian rapper had previously teased Cali's star player while cheering on his home team.
body: Drake is almost definitely in his feelings following the conclusion of the 2025 World Series, which resulted in his home team losing to the Los Angeles Dodgers, who gladly took the opportunity to troll the rapper after their victory by using some Kendrick Lamar lyrics. Related Drake Supports Hometown Blue Jays at Game 6 of the World Series Zohran Mamdani Describes His NYC Mayoral Campaign in 3 Songs: ‘Shout-Out to Taylor Swift’ Drake Trolls Shohei Ohtani & Los Angeles Dodgers With Toronto Blue Jays 1 Win From World Series Title After triumphing over the Toronto Blue Jays in Game 7 on Sunday (Nov. 2), the Cali team shared a group photo of the players and staff wearing “World Series Champions” shirts. “THEY STILL NOT LIKE US,” the Dodgers wrote in the caption, quoting Dot’s famous Billboard Hot 100 -topping diss track against Drizzy. The ribbing comes after Drake spent much of the World Series trolling the L.A. team’s star player, Shohei Ohtani, on social media. Following Game 5, the Toronto native had shared a picture on his Instagram Story of the pitcher wearing a sweater vest and wrote, â€œONE MORE!!!!!!!,â€ after whâ€¦

title: CoComelonâ€™s New Ode to Sleepy Time Has Baby JJ Flying Through the Clouds & Declaring â€˜I Love My Bedâ€™:Â Premiere
summary: The new song is part of CoComelon's effort to help caretakers struggling with bedtime -- especially after Sunday's daylight saving time switch.
body: CoComelon ‘s new song “I Love My Bed” might be a bedtime anthem, but it’s no lullaby. Billboard Family is exclusively premiering the animated music video for “I Love My Bed,” and “animated” is also a good adjective to describe the song, which is more upbeat than most bedtime music, aiming to make an often challenging part of the day fun — especially after Sunday’s daylight saving time switch. “We designed ‘I Love My Bed’ as a true celebration of bedtime,” Joshua Embury, music director at Moonbug Entertainment, tells Billboard Family . “It’s not a traditional wind-down track; it’s high energy and exciting, acting as a great way to frame bedtime as a fun and positive event. We hope this anthem helps make bedtime more exciting for kids.” In the new video, JJ goes on a big adventure, all from the comfort of his trusty bed. But this is no ordinary bed: It’s shaped like a boat, and it takes flight out of JJ’s room and into the skies, soaring through the clouds and out above the ocean before floating right back into JJ’s room where he’s fast asleep. It&#8217â€¦

title: Wrexham Tennis Open to return in 2026
summary: The Wrexham Open to return to the north Wales city next year following the "incredible success" of this year's tournament, which was won by Wales' Mimi Xu.

title: Record field goal & flying touchdowns in NFL's plays of the week
summary: Cam Little's 68-yard field goal, the longest in NFL history, and Jameson Williams' flying touchdown feature in the best plays from the latest round of NFL games.

title: Van de Ven and Spence apologised and meant 'no disrespect' - Frank
summary: Tottenham boss Thomas Frank says Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence have apologised to him after the pair snubbed the manager when leaving the pitch following defeat by Chelsea.

body: STANDARD TERMS & CONDITIONS The terms set out below (the Terms and Conditions) govern the participation in and implementation of related administrative matters pertaining to the Contest (as defined below) to be conducted by FootballCo Media Limited, a company with offices at 175 High Holborn, London WC1V 7AA  (Organizer) for the benefit of Mastercard Building Al Falak Street Dubai Internet City P.O.Box 500003 Dubai, United Arab Emirates Contest Period This Mastercard UCL 4 Quizzes competition (Contest) hosted by the Organizer will run from 00:01 on 1st November 2025 to 23:59 on 6th December 2025 (both dates inclusive) (Contest Period), 1 quiz will be live each week wherein there will be 1 winners for the first 3 quizzes and 2 for the 4th quiz. Eligibility Subject to these Terms and Conditions, the Contest is only open to persons aged 18 years or over who are residents of Saudi Arabia (collectively, the Territories and each, a Territory) (collectively, Eligible Persons and each, an Eligible Person). title: Why VAR won't be getting involved in corners
summary: Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche is frustrated after Casemiro's goal from a corner is allowed to stand, but VAR will not be changing to include them in its remit.

title: There's more that bonds us than separates us - Southgate
summary: Sir Gareth Southgate believes England has an opportunity to "change the narrative" amid concerns the country is becoming less united, when asked about the debate about flying the St George's flag.

title: Tonga's Katoa has surgery after 'seizure activity'
summary: Tonga forward Eli Katoa is stable in hospital as he recovers from surgery after suffering "seizure activity" during Sunday's Pacific Championships match against New Zealand.

title: Trent Bridge pitch master Birks to pull up stumps
summary: Nottinghamshire's head groundsman Steve Birks is to retire in January after a successful 28-year career at Trent Bridge.

title: Schmidt 'disappointed' by England's 'gamesmanship'
summary: Australia coach Joe Schmidt says he was "disappointed, rather than distracted" by England reportedly flagging concerns over the Wallabies' tactics to the referee.

title: Ex-manager O'Neil in talks over Wolves return
summary: Former Wolves boss Gary O'Neil is in talks over a return to the club as manager following the sacking of Vitor Pereira.

title: Ex-manager O'Neil in talks over Wolves return
summary: Former Wolves boss Gary O'Neil is in talks over a return to the club as manager following the sacking of Vitor Pereira.

title: O'Neill 'lit the fuse' & fearless Rohl - fan verdict on Old Firm semi
summary: What Celtic and Rangers fans thought the Scottish League Cup semi-final said about their new managers Martin O'Neill and Danny Rohl.

title: Should Earps' 'negative' comments on Hampton have been made public?
summary: The Women's Football Show pundits Lindsay Johnson & Fern Whelan discuss former England goalkeeper Mary Earps's "negative" comments about Hannah Hampton and whether they should have been made publicly or not.

title: 'I worry about unity' - Southgate on St George's flag
summary: Former England manager Gareth Southgate says there is "more that unites us than separates us" amid a debate about flying the St George's flag.

title: How to follow the Ashes across the BBC
summary: The BBC will deliver comprehensive coverage of the Ashes, with ball-by-ball radio commentary, video highlights, text updates and analysis.

title: Rooney defends punditry after Van Dijk criticism
summary: Wayne Rooney defends his previous criticism of Liverpool and Virgil van Dijk after the Reds captain called the pundit's analysis of their early season struggles "'lazy".

title: How India finally embraced World Cup fever
summary: After a slow start to the group stage where rain was discussed just as much as the cricket, India's eventual World Cup success showed what is possible when given the platform.

title: Alcaraz and Sinner to play exhibition before Australian Open
summary: Carlos Alcaraz will play Jannik Sinner in an exhibition match in South Korea just eight days before the start of the Australian Open.

title: Philadelphia's Embiid fined for 'lewd gesture'
summary: Philadelphia 76ers centre Joel Embiid is fined $50,000 (Â£38,000) by the NBA for what the league determined to be a "lewd gesture" on the court.

title: Will Football Manager help women's football grow?
summary: The launch of the latest edition of the Football Manager series will enhance visibility of the women's game, and could help unearth some unheralded female talents too.

title: Will Alexander-Arnold show what Liverpool are missing on return?
summary: Trent Alexander-Arnold returns to Liverpool for the first time since moving to Real Madrid on Tuesday, when he will discover if absence has made Anfield hearts grow fonder.

title: The tactics behind Sunderland's impressive start
summary: BBC Sport analyses the tactics behind Sunderland's impressive start on their Premier League return.

title: Tuchel must consider calling up Welbeck - Rooney
summary: Wayne Rooney says England manager Thomas Tuchel has to consider striker Danny Welbeck for a recall to his squad.

title: Van Dijk rejects Rooney's 'lazy criticism'
summary: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says Wayne Rooney blaming a lack of leadership for the Anfield side's recent poor form is "lazy criticism".

title: Why winless Wolves' problems go beyond sacked manager Pereira
summary: Former Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick and ex- England goalkeeper Rob Green react to Wolves' sacking of Vitor Pereira on Match of the Day.

title: Man City's high-risk plan - and why it paid off against Bournemouth
summary: Former Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick analyses Manchester City's plan to exploit the middle of the pitch in their 3-1 win against Bournemouth in the Premier League on Match of the Day.

title: Kane considers Barcelona switch - Monday's gossip
summary: Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane considering move to Barcelona, Manchester United and Tottenham monitoring Everton's Jarrad Branthwaite and Liverpool watch Fulham winger Kevin.

title: 'He lives for the goals' - robot Haaland returns from malfunction
summary: Erling Haaland pulled out the robot dance in the win over Bournemouth and his levels were compared to Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo by boss Pep Guardiola.

title: 'Thunderous finish!' - Rashford scores great goal for Barcelona
summary: Marcus Rashford scores his second goal of the season as Barcelona beat Elche 3-1 in La Liga.

title: World Cup win will trigger India juggernaut - Hartley
summary: Former England spinner Alex Hartley says it is "scary" to think of how dominant India could become in women's cricket after their World Cup win over South Africa.

title: 'I don't even know when it is' - but will O'Neill be Celtic manager for final?
summary: After guiding Celtic past Rangers, Martin O'Neill concedes he'd "secretly love" to lead the team in next month's final.

title: Morrison seals Tour return with son, 13, as caddie
summary: James Morrison thought he was playing in his farewell tournament â€“ but instead sealed a return to the DP World Tour with his 13-year-old son as caddie.

title: West Ham come from behind to beat Newcastle
summary: Watch highlights as a spirited West Ham side come from behind to record their first home win of the season against Newcastle United at the London Stadium.

title: Haaland scores twice to send Man City second
summary: Watch highlights as Erling Haaland scores twice for Manchester City in a 3-1 win against Bournemouth which lifts Pep Guardiola's side up to second in the Premier League.

title: Who made your World Cup team of the tournament?
summary: Find out which players made the cut into the BBC Sport team of the tournament for the Women's World Cup.

title: Park stars as Man Utd hold off Brighton to stay unbeaten
summary: Manchester United continue their unbeaten start with a 3-2 victory against Brighton and Hove Albion at Broadfield Stadium in the Women's Super League.

summary: Watch highlights as hosts India beat South Africa by 52 runs to seal a historic first World Cup win in front of a sold-out crowd in Navi Mumbai.

title: Sabalenka dominates but Gauff struggles on serve at WTA Finals
summary: World number one Aryna Sabalenka and defending champion Coco Gauff experience contrasting fortunes with their serves at the WTA Finals.

title: 'Time stood still!' - Amanjot juggles catch to dismiss Wolvaardt
summary: Amanjot Kaur juggles the ball to make a catch on the third attempt and dismiss South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt for 101 in a "huge moment" for the hosts during their Cricket World Cup final in Navi Mumbai.

title: Russo & Blackstenius shine as Arsenal thrash Leicester
summary: Watch highlights as Alessia Russo and Stina Blackstenius help Arsenal thrash Leicester City to their third-consecutive win in all competitions at King Power Stadium in the Women's Super League.

title: 'It didn't look good' - should players ever publicly snub their manager?
summary: After Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence appeared to ignore Thomas Frank following Tottenham's loss to Chelsea, BBC Sport pundits discuss whether it is ever OK to snub the manager?

title: Everton score 90th-minute equaliser in six-goal thriller
summary: Aston Villa and Everton share the points after six-goal thriller featuring a late leveller by Kelly Gago.

title: Points, pubs and Pereira - why a perfect match at Wolves turned sour
summary: Wolves wanted stability and consistency but the axe fell for Vitor Pereira on Sunday with the club eight points from safety.

summary: In his BBC Sport column, World Cup winner Matt Dawson reflects on England's impressive squad depth after Steve Borthwick's side defeated Australia in their first autumn international.

summary: Match of the Day's Gabby Logan, Alan Shearer and Ashley Williams dissect the reaction of Tottenham's Djed Spence and Micky van de Ven after their defeat by Chelsea.

title: England's Ashes hopes end with 'reality check'
